newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico could make another IMF prepayment - Ortiz.
newsitem.headline: Mexico could make another IMF prepayment - Ortiz.

text.p: Mexico could make another prepayment on its debt with the International Monetary Fund if conditions permit, Finance Minister Guillermo Ortiz said on Thursday.

"If we continue with good access to the market we cannot rule out the possibility that we could make an additional prepayment," Ortiz told a forum on the economy. He said Mexico's debt with the IMF was about $10.0 billion.
"This year we made a prepayment of between $2.0 billion and $2.6 billion and the schedule is that for the rest of the year there are regular payments of about $500 million," he said.
Ortiz also expects the trade surplus to decline, although he noted there was a revision upwards in March in the trade surplus to $636 million compared with a preliminary number of $565 million.
